baby.name: Why Do Babies Vomit?
baby.content:
The most common reason why babies vomit in the early weeks after birth is that is some of the milk is being brought up with some air when baby burps.
The other reason why babies vomit often is that the muscle valve at the top of their stomach that opens into the stomach is weak and immature. In adults, this valve closes tightly after swallowing food, to keep food down. It requires much force to push this valve open to allow an adult to vomit. The lid does not close tightly enough in babies. So, a little force can make the valve open, and milk will come out.
Baby may also vomit if the baby's stomach is 'overfull,' or is gently pressed on. For example, if you rest the baby too far over your shoulder, or if you bend over your baby with the baby on your laps.
Vomiting will improve as the baby grow older from about 6 months to 1 year. It will also improve when the baby starts to sit down and to spend more time sitting down and to spend more time sitting.

baby.name: How To Reduce The Fever Of A Baby
baby.content:
a)Use the medicine
b)Take the baby to the clinic and use the drug that you are given. Use the drug the way that you are told. Make sure that you complete the dose.
c)Give the baby a luke-warm bath. The water from the bathing will evaporate from the baby's skin and cool her down. Do not use cold water, because it will make the baby shiver and her temperature will rise.
d)Give extra fluids for the baby to drink. When you give the baby extra fluid, you are cooling it down from the inside.

baby.name: Why Do Babies Have Stomach Pain?
baby.content: Stomach aches are caused by eating too much or too little food, gas in the intestine, or a mild infection. If a child has stomach aches often take him to see a doctor. Frequent stomach aches may be because of constipation, colic, or urinary tract infection.

baby.name: Why Do Babies Get A Fever When Teething?
baby.content: It is common for teething to make babies have a fever and uncomfortable. However, if the temperature is above 101 degrees is likely to be due to an infection rather than teething. If the fever is high take the baby to the doctor.

baby.name: Why Is The Baby Sleeping More Than Usual?
baby.content: Babies sleep more than usual due to an increase in the rate that the baby is growing. The baby may start sleeping for longer in the morning and afternoon. Babies grow during sleep.

baby.name: What Are The Weaning Foods Needed For Babies?
baby.content:
Do not force the child to take the new food. The baby is used to breastmilk, so if the child takes 1 or 2 spoons of the food at each attempt, it is ok. The baby will increase the quantity he takes gradually. Try to be patient and be playful when introducing the food. It will make the baby have an interest in the food.  Keep in mind that you should give only one food at a time. Give the same food for at least 3-4 days before you give another one. Also, do not add many ingredients at once. For example, give only pap first for 3-4 days. Then add milk and give for 3-4 days. Continue to give breastmilk till the baby is at least 1 year old.
a) Pap- pap made from grounded fermented Maize, guinea corn, and soya beans is very simple and easy to make. You can give it with a spoon or make it watery to serve with feeding bottle. This is often the first weaning food that most mothers give their babies.
b) Vegetables and tubers: Well-mashed cooked vegetables are good. You can use the common vegetables and tubers you prepare for the family, like yam, sweet potato, Irish potato, carrots, cassava, and examples of vegetables are dark green leafy plants, tomatoes, etc.
c) Fruit: Mashed banana is very good. Remove the seed from orange and juice it for the baby. Peel the back of apples, remove the seeds and mash it. Make juice from or mash mango, pawpaw and give to the baby.
 d) Beans â€“ peel the back of beans and cook it with little salt and pepper till it is soft. Give to the baby. Give Moimoi and Akara.
 e)Grains and Cereals: Rice is one of the most popular weaning foods. Just make sure it is soft. You can leave other grains like oats or corn until a few months later (wheat, millet, sorghum).
f)Swallows: Amala with Ewedu is a common weaning food for babies in western Nigeria. Add ground crayfish or boiled fish to the soup. It will make the soup a nutritious meal for the baby. As the baby grows older, you give other swallows like Eba, Semovita, Pounded Yam because the baby can digest them. However, ensure that the food is soft enough for your child to eat.
 g)Animal product:  Give animal products such as milk, eggs, cheese, yogurt, fish, chicken and meat.

baby.name: Can I Give My Baby Water At 2 Months?
baby.content: Baby shouldn't drink water until he is 6 months old. This is called exclusive breastfeeding. It will make sure that your baby gets the best nutrition from breastmilk. Breastmilk contains enough water for the baby. So, give breastmilk even when the baby has a hiccup. Once your baby is 6 months old, it's okay to give him sips of water when he's thirsty. This is because the baby will start to take other food that is harder than breastmilk and contains oil, pepper, meat, etc. which will need water to help the digestion.

baby.name: What Causes Baby Stooling During The Teething Period?
baby.content: Teething does not cause stooling. Stooling happens because babies often put their hands and other things into their mouth. They put things into their mouth because the gum is itching them. The hands and the things they put into their mouth may have touched germs. The germs make them stool.

baby.name: What Causes Choking In Babies?
baby.content: Choking is a common cause of injury and death in young children. It is because their small airways are easily blocked. It takes time for babies to know how to chew and swallow food properly. Babies may not be able to cough forcefully enough to clear their airway obstruction.

baby.name: What Causes Birth Defects?
baby.content:
Many things can cause birth defects. They include
 a)Lack of nutritious food during pregnancy
 b)Lack of iodine in a pregnant woman's food.
 c)Lack of folic acid in the body of woman before she gets pregnant
 d)Hereditary issues- the baby may inherit some things from the family that makes it form badly
 e)Environmental factors- the mother may be having contact with chemical, tobacco, drugs and alcohol, diseases such as German measles. These things affect a baby in the womb and may make the baby form badly.
 f)Age of the woman is above 35 years
 g)Taking many different medicines during pregnancy 
 h)Difficulties during delivery

baby.name: What Is The Cause Of Jaundice In Newborn Babies?
baby.content: Jaundice is when the skin of the body and the white part of the eyes turns yellow. Jaundice is not a disease but is a sign of a disease. Jaundice in babies is caused by an increase in the destruction of red blood cells in the body, and the liver is not able to remove the waste product. It is common in premature babes and when the baby is newly born.

baby.name: How To Care For The Cord
baby.content:
Make sure that you use methylated spirit and cotton wool to clean the baby' cord several times a day. You may decide that you will clean the cord every time you change the diaper daily. Pay attention to the base of the cord that is the part nearest to the belly button. Always allow air to reach the cord often so that it can dry up and heal on time. Prevent diapers from rubbing against the cord. You can fold the diaper so that it does not cover the cord. Allow the cord stump to fall off on its own. Do not pull it. Do not apply kerosene, dusting powder in other to force the cord to fall off early. There is nothing to worry if the cord does not fall before 7 days as long as the cord is cleaned regularly, kept dry and air touches it. 
Note that when the cord is still on the baby do not dip the baby in a bath while bathing so that the cord will not get wet.

baby.name: How Does Food Reach Baby In The Womb?
baby.content: Food reaches the developing baby through the umbilical cord from the placenta. After the mother's food is digested, the food will be absorbed into the blood and go from mother to child through the placenta. The placenta filters away harmful things, such as germs to protect the fetus.

baby.name: How To Take Good Care For Your Baby
baby.content: Make sure you and the baby are hygienic. Hold your baby right. Don't shake your baby strongly. Don't play rough play with your child. Let your skin touch the skin of your baby. Talk to your baby often. Always check the diapers and change on time if it is wet or if the baby poops. Feed the baby anytime the baby wants food. Breastfeed the baby for 6 months without giving water and introduce nutritious foods after 6 months. Sterilize feeding bottles and breast pumps regularly when you feed the baby with other foods. Take proper care of the umbilical cord by cleaning with methylated spirit and cotton wool and keep the cord dry. Bath your baby and keep him dry. Put your baby to sleep on the baby bed. Remove toys away from the baby bed. Clean your room and baby's room often. Dress your baby right that means look at the weather and wear the cloths that are good for the weather for your baby. Always comfort your baby when he is crying. Never leave your baby alone. Go to the doctor on time when the baby is sick. Immunize your child at the health center.

baby.name: Baby Teething
baby.content:
Baby teething is when a baby is growing teeth, it is a normal part of a baby's growth. Teething can cause pain, high body temperature, and discomfort, which can be stressful for the baby and the parents. Stooling is not a sign of baby teething, but it is a sign of infection in the baby's stomach.
Ways to soothe pain caused by teething;
a)Rub your baby's mouth with a clean finger; rub a finger over your baby's gums. Applying little pressure on the gum can relieve some of the pain.
b)Keep your baby's mouth cool. Keeping it cool can relieve some of the pain of teething. You can use a cold spoon, or a slightly cool teething ring to help your baby feel better.
c)Use teething toys. Teething toys are usually soft plastic toys which babies can bite with their gums when the gum is itching them.
d)Use only common pain reliever. Do not use medicine that the doctor didn't tell you.

baby.name: What Makes Baby Get Cold?
baby.content: Symptoms of the common cold in babies are sneezing, runny nose and difficulty in breathing. Sometimes there can be a sore throat, cough, and high temperature. Naturally babies are prone to cold and cough because of their low immunity. When babies are exposed to older children every day, it makes them likely to get cold. Also, exposing the baby's head and feet can make them get cold quickly. To prevent cold in babies make sure that you dress them up appropriately depending on the weather.

baby.name: How To Treat Cold In Babies
baby.content:
There is no cure for the common cold in babies but you can help the baby to get better. You can give pain relief that is for the age of the baby in the correct dosage if prescribed by your doctor. Do not give aspirin to babies and children. You can do the following;
Give plenty of fluid that is breast milk for an infant less than 6 months. If the baby is older increase the volume of diluted fruit juice that contains vitamin C that you give.
a)Always keep the baby's room warm.
b)Keep the baby away from the smoke.
c)Suck out the mucus in baby's nose.
d)Make the baby sleeps well at night.
e)If the baby cannot sleep well at night, put him on a semi-sitting position on your body so that he can breathe well.

baby.name: When Should I Call The Doctor on My Baby's Health?
baby.content:
If the baby is younger than 3 months, and he has a cold. This is because it may be a sign of something more serious. Call the doctor or take the baby to the doctor if:
a)The baby has a very serious cough.
b)The baby is hot.
c)The symptoms continue for more than 10 days.
d)The baby has an earache. You can know this if the baby keeps pulling his ear and he is not comfortable.
e)The baby stops to take food or breast milk.
f)The baby's breathing is difficult.
g)The mucus that is coming out is thick and green.
h)The baby looks tired.

baby.name: Immunization/Vaccination
baby.content: Vaccination is given to reduce the occurrence of infectious disease. Vaccination is much better and cheaper than taking medications for a disease. Many people spread myths on vaccination, and it prevents some parents from vaccinating their children. This has led to the occurrence of measles, polio and other vaccine preventable diseases. Ensure that you take your children for all the routine immunization after delivery. Immunization makes your child healthy, it saves money spent on medications and reduces worries from sickness.

baby.name: Importance Of Breastfeeding Of Babies
baby.content:
a)Breastfeeding has many benefits for the baby. The benefits of breastfeeding include;
b)Breastmilk helps your baby grow healthy and strong
c)Breastmilk is the beast nutrition for your baby
d)Breastmilk changes to meet your growing baby's need
e)Breastfed babies often have to visit the hospital less.
f)Breastfeeding makes you and your baby closer.
g)Breastfed babies have less colic, constipation, and diarrhea.
h)Breastmilk is gentle to your baby's stomach and easy to digest.
i)Breastmilk is just what your baby needs in the right amount.
j)Breastmilk is clean and prevents infections from bottle feeding.
k)Breastmilk has a perfect mix of vitamin, protein, and fat - everything the baby needs to grow.
l)Breastfed infants are more likely to gain the right amount of weight as they grow faster than become overweight children.
m)Breastfeeding lowers your baby's risk of having asthma or allergies.
n)Breastfeeding also lowers the risk of diabetes, obesity and some cancer too.

mother.name: How To Make Your Belly Flat After Child Delivery
mother.content:
a) Press your belly with hot water to allow the steam to get to your private part.
b)Tie your belly with a cloth after pressing it with hot water or sitting on a hot water
c)Drink hot pepper soup
d)Take warm water to avoid taking cold or ordinary water
e)You could sit on hot water if you did Cesarean Section (CS)
f)Keep doing all the things said above for more than 3 months after delivery.
NB: Don't stop when the stomach is at the size you want. Because if you stay there, the tummy will become bigger later. So, press beyond where you want to stop it. The reason is that the belly will still increase in size after you stop. So it will come back to the point that you want it to be.

mother.name: Care Of The Breast During Pregnancy
mother.content:
Special care of your breasts is very important throughout your pregnancy. Here are some breast care tips during pregnancy:
Hygiene Practices For The Breast
There are some hygienic practices you do during your pregnancy:
a)Wash your nipples. The body fluid passes through the breast from the fifth month of pregnancy. It looks like a hard layer, and the surrounding skin looks red. You can avoid this by making your nipples clean. To make the nipples clean, rub them with a clean piece of cloth.
b)Do not to use soap to clean nipples because it can cause dryness and make the nipple crack. Sesame oil or petroleum jelly is good to keep the nipples soft.
c)To make your nipple large for easy breastfeeding always pull your nipples with the forefinger and thumb when you are bathing. Take care not to scratch the nipples with your nails. This exercise will help milk flow after delivery.
d)Massage your breasts by rubbing them in circles when bathing with oil and water. Breast massage helps proper blood flow.
e)Always wear a bra to support the weight of your breasts. Make sure that you do much pressure on the breast by wearing a very tight bra. Do not use a bra that has underwires in it because they disturb the production of milk.
f)Use maternity bra for breastfeeding. Maternity bras will make breastfeeding easier by it gives support to the breast.

mother.name: How Does Pregnancy Occur?
mother.content:
Every woman has eggs in her in two places in her body above the womb. One egg is released every month so that if a man's sperm meets it, the egg and the sperm can become a baby.  When a woman menstruates, it takes about 28 days before the next menstruation. The first day of the menses is the first day of the menstrual cycle. On the 14th day after the first of day menstruation, an egg comes out to the womb. The egg remains alive for 2 days in the womb waiting for sperm to join with it and make it fertilized so that it can grow into a baby.
When the egg is fertilized, it attaches itself to the wall of the womb, and it starts to grow into a baby. The baby grows in the womb for about 9 months, and it is delivered.

mother.name: Why Does A Pregnant Woman Vomit?
mother.content: The main cause of vomiting during pregnancy is not known. But is likely to be due to changes in the body hormones.

mother.name: What Are The Foods To Avoid While Pregnant?
mother.content:
a)Do not eat uncooked meat and fish or they it are not well cooked- Uncooked meat and fish and if they are not well cooked contains germs that are dangerous to a pregnant woman and her baby.
b)Do not eat uncooked eggs- Uncooked eggs may contain germs which are harmful to a pregnant woman. Do not eat any food made with uncooked eggs. Eggs must be properly cooked before you eat it.
c)Do not eat un-boiled raw milk- Don't drink un-boiled raw milk, or cheeses made from it un-boiled raw milk. It means that do not drink milk that is collected fresh from an animal. You must boil the milk before you drink it.
d)Wash all fruits and vegetables- Wash fruits and vegetables very well and remove all the soil from it before you eat or cook them.
e)Do not drink alcohol- Alcohol may damage the baby and affect the baby's growth in the womb. Alcohol can affect your baby's development.
f)Reduce caffeine- When caffeine is taken a lot during pregnancy, it reduces the weight of the baby at birth. Too much caffeine can also cause miscarriage. Some soft drink contains caffeine. An example is Cola drinks. So reduce the bottles of Cola drink that you take during pregnancy.

mother.name: Can a pregnant woman still have a regular period?
mother.content: Yes, you can still get regular blood flow when you are pregnant. Some women have vaginal bleeding during pregnancy. Some even have regular bleeding that looks like a regular period. But vaginal bleeding during pregnancy is not the same thing as menses. Monthly bleeding while pregnant may be because of change in the cervix which makes it softer, multiple pregnancies such as twins and infection.

mother.name: Causes of Malaria In Pregnancy
mother.content:
Malaria is common in areas where there is a high amount of rainfall and temperature such as Africa. The environment is good for the mosquito to grow.  The following factors can cause malaria during pregnancy;
a) Loss of immunity: Pregnancy makes a woman's resistance to disease to reduce. This makes the pregnant woman likely to contract malaria
b) Areas where there is Malaria: Women in an area where malaria is common often have immunity against malaria. So, they are not likely to get malaria. But in areas where malaria is not common, women have lower resistance to malaria, so they have a high tendency to get malaria infection.
c) HIV infection: Women infected with HIV have a high risk of contracting malaria because of their immunity low.

mother.name: Signs And Symptoms Of Malaria In Pregnancy
mother.content:
In its early stage, the symptoms of malaria look like other infections so a blood test can be similar to those of influenza or viral infection. Only a blood test can help determine the exact infection. The common symptoms of malaria in pregnancy are:
a) High fever and sweating or feeling cold
b) Nausea
c)  A cough
d) A headache
e)  Vomiting
f)  Muscle pain
g) Diarrhea
h)  Jaundice
i)  Breathing problem
j) Enlargement of the Spleen
k) Pale skin appearance
l)  General illness
It is important to recognize and treat pregnancy malaria early because it can cause other health problems both for the mother and the baby.

mother.name: Complications Of Malaria In Pregnancy
mother.content:
Malaria is can be a common or severe infection. The common malaria infection has symptoms such as headache, fever, shivering, and sweating that occur every two to three days and last for six to ten hours.
Severe malaria is very dangerous to life. It can cause anemia, serious breathing problem, cerebral malaria, and organ damages. Here are some of the complications in expecting mothers:
Anemia during pregnancy is cause by the malaria germ that destroy the blood cell. Anemia may cause bleeding after delivery leading to the death of mother and baby. Severe malaria can lead to leaking of water into the lungs. It also causes the weakness in the ability of the body to fight diseases. Severe malaria during pregnancy can lead to low blood sugar level in the woman.

mother.name: Why Does a Woman Have Breastmilk during pregnancy?
mother.content:
Many mothers' breast brings out to leak colostrum (sometimes called Pre-milk) while they are pregnant often in the third trimester. Other expectant moms do not. It is normal either to have milk coming out or not. You can wear nursing pads in your bra to protect your clothes if milk is coming out.
Colostrum is a thick, yellowish fluid that contains antibodies that help protect new babies from infections. If you choose to breastfeed, this precious liquid will nourish your baby until your milk comes in. Colostrum has more protein, but less carbohydrate and fat than mature breast milk. It's easy to digest and has just the right amount of nutrients a baby needs in the first few days after birth.

mother.name: What Causes Insomnia During Pregnancy?
mother.content:
a) Discomfort due to the increased size of your stomach
b)  Back pain
c) Hear burn
d) Frequent urination during the night
e) Anxiety
f) Anticipating the arrival of your baby
g) Frequent and clear dream
h)  Hormonal changes

mother.name: How Can I Cope Or Treat My Insomnia During Pregnancy?
mother.content:
a) Try new sleeping positions.
b) Prepare yourself for sleep by taking a warm bath or a gentle massage.
c) Set up your room for a comfortable sleep setting. Try changing your thermostat to a comfortable temperature and playing some relaxing or natural sounds that can help make you sleepy.
d)  Try relaxation techniques, such as the ones you may have learned in a pregnancy clinic.
e) If you still cannot fall asleep, you may consider getting up. You can try reading a book, eating a small snack, or drinking some warm milk.
f) Exercise regularly during the day.
g)  If you have the opportunity to sleep during the day, you should take it. However, long naps may interfere with your sleeping schedule at night.

mother.name: What Causes High Blood Pressure During Pregnancy?
mother.content:
An unhealthy way of life may lead to high blood pressure during pregnancy.  An unhealthy way of life that can cause high blood pressure during pregnancy include; being overweight, being inactive, smoking, drinking alcohol.
A woman who is pregnant for the first time more likely to have high blood pressure. Women pregnant with many babies are more likely to develop hypertension because their body is under more stress. When a family has the history of hypertension during pregnancy, the woman is likely to have hypertension during pregnancy too.
Age of the woman is also a factor, pregnant women over the age of 40 are more at risk. Women who had high blood pressure before pregnancy are at higher risk for related complications during pregnancy than those with normal blood pressure.

mother.name: What Is The Normal Blood Pressure During Pregnancy?
mother.content:
To determine what your normal blood pressure is during pregnancy, your doctor will likely take a baseline blood pressure measurement at your first visit. Then they will measure your blood pressure at every visit that follows.
Normal blood pressure without pregnancy is usually somewhere close to 120/80 mm Hg.
A blood pressure that is greater than 140/90 mm Hg, or that is 15 degrees higher on the top number from where you started before pregnancy, may be cause for concern.
Early in pregnancy, usually from 5 weeks' pregnant to the middle of the second trimester, a pregnant woman's blood pressure may decrease. This is because pregnancy hormones can stimulate blood vessels to widen. As a result, the resistance to blood flow isn't as high.

mother.name: What Is Low Blood Pressure During Pregnancy?
mother.content:
While there isn't a definitive number that is too low, there are symptoms that are associated with low blood pressure:
a) headache
b)  dizziness
c) nausea
d)  feeling faint
e) cold, damp skin

mother.name: How to Monitor Your Blood Pressure During Pregnancy
mother.content:
There are many ways that you can monitor your blood pressure during pregnancy. You can do the following;
a) Buy a blood pressure monitor from a pharmacy. To make sure that the machine is working well, take it to your doctor's office and compare the readings on your machine to the doctor's machine readings.
b) Go to good pharmacies or other stores that have a machine that takes blood pressure readings.
c) For the best result make sure that you take your blood pressure at the same time every day. Sit down when doing the blood pressure check. Do not cross your legs. Do not hold anything in your hand. Always use the same arm to monitor your blood pressure.
d)  Tell your doctor immediately if you have any symptoms of high blood pressure.

mother.name: What Are The Complications Of High Blood Pressure During Pregnancy?
mother.content:
If high blood pressure continues after 20 weeks of pregnancy, there can be complications. Preeclampsia can develop.
Medication for high blood pressure during pregnancy
Some traditional blood pressure medications can cause problems in pregnant women. Visit your doctor for medicine to take if you have high blood pressure when you are pregnant 
Talk to your doctor about how to control your blood pressure if you develop hypertension during pregnancy.
High blood pressure during pregnancy doesn't usually lead to serious problems. However, if it goes untreated, hypertension can become life-threatening for both mother and baby. Unfortunately, hypertensive disorders resulting from high blood pressure are the second-leading cause of maternal death during pregnancy.
Always talk to your doctor about your health problems. Follow all the dos and don'ts of pregnancy care so that you can be healthy.
Try to understand the factors that cause high blood pressure before you get pregnant â€” and take preventive measures to keep your blood pressure down during pregnancy.

mother.name: What Is Preeclampsia?
mother.content:
This condition can cause serious damage to your organs, including your brain and kidneys. Preeclampsia is also known as toxemia or pregnancy-induced hypertension. Preeclampsia with seizures becomes eclampsia. This can be fatal.
Thorough prenatal care, including regular doctor's visits, should be able to address preeclampsia symptoms. Symptoms include:
a) protein in a urine sample
b) abnormal swelling in hands and feet
c) persistent headaches

mother.name: How To Bend Down While Pregnant
mother.content:
Remember to lower your knees instead of stretching your back.
It would be better if you always got up slowly using your hands, thighs, and knees rather than straining the muscles of the belly. It will help to protect your back while allowing you to perform daily activities as your pregnancy grows.
While lifting an object, try to bend your head down. Just bend your knees instead.

mother.name: How To Maintain Good Posture During Pregnancy
mother.content:
Good posture during pregnancy involves training the baby to walk, sit, lie and standing positions where you do not feel any strain. The big belly may make you feel like you are going to fall. By taking this few steps, you can effectively maintain proper body mechanics. Here are a few posture tips that you must follow during pregnancy:
Sitting Posture
Standing posture 
Sitting posture
Driving posture
The correct way to lift an object
Sleeping and lying position

mother.name: Causes Of Frequent Urine During Pregnancy
mother.content:
Frequent urination during pregnancy is often caused by pregnancy hormones, an increase in the amount and speed of blood circulating through your body, and your growing uterus.
Hormonal changes make your blood flow to your kidney more quickly, filling your bladder more often â€“ which causes more frequent urination during pregnancy.
Your blood volume also increases throughout your pregnancy until you have almost 50 percent more blood circulating in your blood than before you got pregnant. This means much extra fluid is getting through your kidneys and going into your bladder.
Your growing uterus eventually puts pressure on your bladder, further compounding the problem late in your pregnancy.

mother.name: What Causes Tiredness During Pregnancy
mother.content: Tiredness is a common symptom during pregnancy. Some women may feel tired throughout their pregnancy, while some may not feel tired at all. Changes in hormone during the early stage of pregnancy often cause tiredness and make you feel sleepy. Also, your body is producing more blood to carry nutrient to the baby in the womb. The level of sugar and blood pressure is lower. Your emotions of worry also affect how you feel physically. During the last three months of pregnancy, tiredness is caused by the extra weight of the baby.

mother.name: How to cope with tiredness Coping During Pregnancy
mother.content:
a) Restâ€“ Sleep more when you are tired. Try to sleep earlier at night and has a short sleep during the day. Reduce the quantity of liquid you drink before you sleep so that you will not get up more to urinate at night.
b) Adjust Schedule â€“ reduce the amount of work you do. Get people to help so that you would not get tired often.
c) Eat a Balanced Dietâ€“ Eat nutritious food to help increase your energy. Take enough protein and iron. Take enough water to keep you hydrated.
d)  Moderate Exercise â€“ moderate exercise such as a 30-minute walk will make you free strong. But ask from your health care provider before you do any exercise.

mother.name: Sex During Pregnancy
mother.content: When the pregnancy is normal it is possible for you to keep having sex till you are about to deliver. But sometimes due to such health issues you may need to stop having sex during your pregnancy. Your health care provider will advise on what is best for you.

mother.name: Emotional Care And Diet during Pregnancy
mother.content:
Apart from the hygiene routine, you also need to take care of the following; 
a) You must relax during pregnancy and lactation period. Emotional disturbances and stress affect milk secretion.
b) You must take a balanced diet rich in iron and protein. Also, ensure you get adequate vitamins and calcium. Include vegetables and fruits wisely to increase your daily water intake. 
c) If you experience tender and sensitive breast, it is caused by the hormones. Pregnancy is the time when milk-producing ducts start developing and are stretched to fill milk. This makes your breasts all the more sensitive, the nipples particularly.

mother.name: Preventions of Problems During Pregnancy
mother.content:
To avoid problems of any sorts, make sure to follow the prevention measures properly. Here is what to do:
a) Wash your breasts with clean water daily. 
b) Make sure to inspect your breasts on a regular basis. 
c) If you notice any changes or discomforts in your breast, make sure to inform your health care provider as early as possible. 
d) Do not keep your breasts wet as that might lead to cracks in the nipples.

mother.name: What kind of sign during sex should Make Me call my doctor or midwife?
mother.content: When you are going through anything, call your doctor or midwife.  It's normal to feel some cramping during or just after intercourse or orgasm, but if it doesn't go away after a few minutes, or if you have any pain or bleeding after sex, call your caregiver.

mother.name: What Causes Vaginal Discharge During Pregnancy?
mother.content: When you become pregnant, your body changes in many ways. One of the first changes you may experience is in your vaginal discharge. Changes in your vagina discharge are normal but tell your doctor if you notice anything abnormal.

mother.name: What Are the Dos and Don'ts of Pregnancy?
mother.content:
During pregnancy do not: 
a)Use tampons-because they can bring new germs into the vagina. 
b)Flush the vagina with water or other fluids. Some mix water mixed with vinegar, iodine or baking soda. It is not good because it can change the normal balance of healthy bacteria in the vagina and lead to infection. 
c)Treat infections by yourself. Always allow the doctor to test and treat you. During pregnancy do: 
a)Use panty liners if it makes you more comfortable.
b)Inform your health care provider of any changes that you see.
c)Rest well- it will help you gain strength.
d)Do not overwork- it will lead to fatigue, and it may cause complications.

mother.name: When Should I Tell My Health Care Provider About My Vaginal Discharge?
mother.content: You should tell your health care provider any time there is a change in normal pregnancy discharge. NEVER try to diagnose and treat yourself.  Blood spotting during pregnancy can be normal but should be mentioned to your health care provider. Inform your doctor immediately if you experience spotting or bleeding that is enough to fill a pad or tampon, lasts longer than a day, and is you are feeling cramps or pain

mother.name: Why A Pregnant Woman May Not Able To Take Solid Foods During Third Trimester?
mother.content: It normal for a pregnant woman to have many uncommon discomforts and complains. A pregnant may not be able to take solid food because of the feeling being full always. The size of the baby causes this feeling in the belly. This may lead to uneasy feelings when you eat heavy food. Do not be worried, it is normal, but if you are unable to eat food at all, please see your health care provider. Check What is the Common Third Trimester of Pregnancy Condition?

mother.name: What Are The Common Third Trimester Of Pregnancy Conditions?
mother.content:
a)Lack of Appetite- Many women they have a low appetite during the last three months of pregnancy. One reason is the pressure of the growing fetus on your abdomen. There is less room for food. The best way to cope is to eat something, even a small snack, every 3 to 4 hours. Don't drink water or juice with a meal. This is because liquid fills your stomach quickly, leaving less room for solid food. 
b)Constipation- Constipation is common among women in the first trimester and the final months of pregnancy. Take more fluid, fruits, and vegetables to help you pass feces easily.
c)Edema- Sometimes extra water accumulates in your body. This can lead to swelling on your legs and feet. To reduce this symptom, take less or remove salt from your food, place your feet on a stool when you want to sit down for long.
d) Shortness of Breath/Fatigue- During the last three months of pregnancy, you will be carrying a heavy load because of the increase in growth of the fetus. Your expanding uterus puts pressure on the respiratory system and leads to shortness of breath and tiredness. Sometimes you may not be able to sleep well because you are feeling uncomfortable. When you do not have enough sleep, it can lead to fatigue.
e) Indigestion and Heartburn- The growing fetus will put pressure on the digestive tract and cause some of the things in the stomach to go back up into the throat. This causes heartburn. To reduce heartburn, eat small meals at regular intervals, chew your food thoroughly and eat slowly. Do not lie down immediately after eating. 
f)High Blood Pressure- when Edema is serious it can be a sign of pre-eclampsia which causes high blood pressure. Sometimes there is hypertension caused by pregnancy. The high blood pressure can hinder blood flow to the placenta and deprive the fetus oxygen and nutrients. If you have hypertension you need to get more rest, do not stand for long and if you want to sit for long put your feet on a small stool or pillow.
g)Urinary Tract Infections- Urinary Tract infections are common during pregnancy. During the last trimester it may lead to kidney infection if it not properly treated. Kidney infection can cause forced labor.

mother.name: Guidelines For Exercise During Pregnancy
mother.content: When you exercise moderately you prevent serious complications such as pre-eclampsia, high blood pressure. Moderate exercise during pregnancy can prevent some aches and pains due to increase body weight. The experience during pregnancy is different for everyone and each pregnancy so take care and ask your doctor for guidance.

mother.name: Stomach Pain During Pregnancy
mother.content: Stomach pain occurs during pregnancy as a result of your body changing to accommodate your growing baby. Some stomach pains can be serious so when you find that the pain is much, complain to your health care provider.

mother.name: Common Causes of Stomach Pain During Pregnancy
mother.content:
Some stomach pains during pregnancy are quite common and generally is not dangerous to you and your baby. Some common pains include:
a)Round Muscle Pain: this pain is sharp and like a stab that you feel when you change positions. It can also be a dull pain that remains for some time. Round muscle pain is caused by the two large muscles that run from your uterus to your anus.  As the uterus grows bigger, these muscles are stretched and causes discomfort. This pain is common in the second trimester and is harmless. 
b)Gas and Constipation: Gas during pregnancy is caused by high levels of a hormone.  The more this hormone is released, your intestine's work slows down, and it makes food travel more slowly. To reduce the number of time that this pain happens, drink plenty of water, eat foods rich in fiber and exercise.
c)Practice contractions: Practice contraction is not dangerous to you and your baby. Many women report that this contraction feels like a tightening of the stomach muscles so that stomach feels firm or hard. It feels like real labor contraction. It is important to know the difference between practice contractions from true contractions. The real contraction will be closer together, last for a longer period, and are painful. True contractions will take your breath away and disturb your normal activities. However, practice contraction will allow you to carry on your normal activities. Also, doctors report that this can be caused by dehydration, so drinking plenty of water can help eliminate this problem. 
d)General Discomforts: It is common for pregnant women to have discomfort due to growing uterus, sensitivities to foods and changing body.

mother.name: Types of Serious Stomach Pain During Pregnancy
mother.content:
Although many women who experience stomach pain have healthy pregnancies, there are times when stomach pain can be a serious risk.  If you have any severe symptoms, such as those discussed below, please consult your medical care provider immediately.
a)Pregnancy Outside The Womb: This occurs in 1 out of 50 pregnancies. A pregnancy outside the womb is when the egg is growing anywhere outside the womb.  Most often, the egg is implanted in the fallopian tube. But an ectopic pregnancy cannot continue to full term, and it requires medical treatment.  When a woman has an ectopic pregnancy, there may be severe pain and bleeding between 6th and 10th weeks of pregnancy. An ectopic pregnancy is common among women who have had an ectopic pregnancy in the past or have had endometriosis, a tubal ligation, or an intrauterine device (IUD) at time of conception. 
b)Placental breakage: Placental breakage is a life-threatening condition in which the placenta separates from the uterus before the baby is born. A symptom of placental abruption is constant pain that causes the stomach to stay hard for a long period without relief. Another sign is the flow of bloody fluid or premature breakage of water. Also, there may be tenderness in the stomach, back pain, or fluid discharge with blood. 
c)Miscarriage: It is the most common form of pregnancy loss. A miscarriage often happens in the first 13 weeks of pregnancy. Signs of a miscarriage include mild to severe back pain, true contractions (happening every 5-20 minutes), tissue or clot-like material passing from the vagina, brown or bright red bleeding with or without cramps, and a sudden decrease in other signs of pregnancy. 
d)Urinary Tract Infection: Urinary Tract Infection can be easily treated during pregnancy but if it is ignored it can cause complications. The signs are; pain, discomfort, and burning when urinating. Also, there can be a lower belly pain, nausea, fever, sweats or cold go for a medical checkup immediately case.
e)Preeclampsia: Symptoms of Preeclampsia are high blood pressure and protein in the urine after 20-weeks pregnancy. There can be a pain in the upper part of the belly, usually under the ribs on the right side, nausea, vomiting and increased pressure on the stomach.

mother.name: When Should I Call My Doctor?
mother.content:
Please call your health care provider immediately if you have any of the following symptoms with abdominal pain or discomfort:
a)Cold
b)Severe or continuous pain
c)Dizziness
d)Fever
e)Spotting or bleeding
f)Nausea and vomiting
g)Vaginal discharge
h)Discomfort while urinating.

mother.name: Breastfeeding
mother.content: Breast milk provides the best nutrition for infants. It has the best mix of everything that your baby needs such as proteins, vitamins, and fat. Breastmilk is easily digested than baby food. Breast milk contains antibodies that help your baby fight diseases. Exclusive breastfeeding is breastfeeding baby with only breast milk for the first 6 months without giving anything else reduces the risk of your baby having asthma or allergies, diarrhea, ear infections, respiratory illnesses, and hospitalizations.

mother.name: Importance of Breastfeeding to The Mother
mother.content: Breastfeeding can help you to lose weight gained during pregnancy faster. It helps your uterus contract back to its size before pregnancy. Breastfeeding helps to reduce bleeding after birth. Breastfeeding also lowers your risk of breast and ovarian cancer. It may lower your risk of osteoporosis, too. It saves time and money. It also gives mothers regular time to relax quietly with their baby. Breastfeeding makes mothers closer to their baby. Breastfeeding saves money- there is nothing to buy. Breastfeeding reduces poverty because it is free. See also the importance of breastfeeding to the baby under general health section.

mother.name: What Makes Breast Milk to Come?
mother.content: During pregnancy, the placenta helps the body to produce hormones to develop the milk making process in the breasts. After the birth of the baby, there is a decrease in a hormone called progesterone which makes the breasts to start producing milk about 32-40 hours after birth. Another hormone called Oxytocin helps the milk to flow out of the breast at each time you feed the baby.

mother.name: When Does Breast Milk Come In to The Breast?
mother.content: Breast milk starts to come in about two to three days after delivery of the baby. Colostrum comes first followed by regular breast milk. Breast milk flow increases as the baby suck the breast, or you use a breast pump or hand to express milk from the breast. If milk is not removed from the breast, milk production will stop.

mother.name: What Causes Delay in Breast Milk Flow?
mother.content:
Although breast milk comes out within three days of delivery, sometimes it may take up to five days. Do not panic that your breast milk is not coming on time because that does not mean that it will not come at all. The more you become worried about it, the worse it can become because worry will affect the flow of the milk. Keep giving the breast for the baby to suck to help start the flow of milk. If you have this problem, speak to your health provider. Some factors cause delayed breast milk flow. They include;
a)Premature delivery may make the breast not produce enough milk. It is because the pregnancy did not go through the whole process of development hence the body does not that time to prepare the breast for milk production.
b)Very stressful birth such as long labor, long pushing stage, cesarean section or use of forceps can cause a delay in breast milk flow.
c)Damage in nerves connected to milk flow or shift in the bones of the spine.
d)A large number of drips used during delivery can accumulate in the breast and delay the production of milk. 
e)Retained part of the placenta can cause the milk production to delay because the hormone called progesterone will remain high. It is when progesterone reduces that milk production will start.
f)Losing much blood may damage a part of the brain that controls breast milk. 
g)Delivery of heavy babies at the first birth may delay of milk production.
h)The pain relief given during childbirth can cause a delay in breast milk flow.
i)Separation of the baby from its mother for long may lead to a delay in breast milk flow. Breastfeeding the baby within the first hour after delivery helps to stimulate good milk production.
j)Overweight or obesity is linked to reducing breast milk production because it disturbs the body from responding to the hormone that produces milk.

mother.name: What Causes Pains After Delivery of baby?
mother.content: Pains after delivery are pains caused by contraction of the womb.  The contraction is to make the womb return back to its size before pregnancy and helps to reduce loss of blood after delivery. Pain after delivery can be mild or serious depending on the number of births and the way the muscle of the stomach is. Breastfeeding the baby makes the womb to contract. Often the pain after delivery is much after first one or two days after delivery and reduces after the third day. It can take six or more weeks after delivery before the womb contracts to its normal size.

mother.name: How Can I Relieve The Pains that Comes After Delivery?
mother.content:
The following can help;a
)Massage your lower belly gently. 
b)Lie face down with a pillow under your lower belly.
c)Lie face down with a warm heating pad under your lower belly.
d)Try to urinate often even when you don't feel like. It is because a full bladder disturbs the uterus from contracting completely. 
e)Take a pain reliever. Always ask your health provider before you take any medication.

mother.name: Placenta Previa
mother.content:
The placenta is made up of cells that form inside the womb during pregnancy. Placenta carries oxygen and nourishment from mother to the fetus, and it carries waste products and carbon dioxide from the fetus to the mother through the umbilical cord. Placenta normally grows in the upper part of the uterus. It allows more space for the fetus to grow. Placenta previa is when the placenta forms very low in the womb or over the entrance of the womb and cause blockage of normal delivery of the baby. There are three types of placenta previa;
a)Complete placenta previa: The placenta completely covers the internal entrance of the womb.
c)Partial placenta previa: The placenta covers part of the internal opening.
c)Marginal placenta previa: The placenta is at the edge of the internal opening of the womb.

mother.name: Causes Of Placenta Previa
mother.content:
a)The fertilized egg implanted very low in the uterus, causing the placenta to form close to or over the cervical opening.
b)The placenta formed abnormally.
c)The mother is older. The risk of developing placenta previa is 3 times higher in women over 30 years of age than women under 20 years of age.
d)The mother may have had several previous pregnancies. The chances of developing placenta previa are increased to 1 in 20 for women who have had 6 or more pregnancies.
e)The lining of the womb has abnormal things such as fibroids or scar from previous Previa, cuttings, cesarean sections or abortions.
f)The pregnancy is multiple such as twins or triplets. The chances of developing placenta previa are doubled for these pregnancies.
g)The mother smokes or uses cocaine. Smoking and cocaine use can increase the risk of this condition.
h)The pregnancy was with the help of assisted reproductive technology, such as in-vitro fertilization.

mother.name: Symptoms of Placenta Previa
mother.content:
Sometimes there can be little bleeding during the first and second trimester of pregnancy. The color of the blood may be bright red, and it may start and stop, then restart after several days or weeks. Sudden and much bleeding may occur in the third trimester of pregnancy. The bleeding does not usually come with pain. There may be pain during bleeding in some women. In 7% to 30% of women who have placenta previa, there may be no bleeding at all. The bleeding happens because as the pregnancy is growing, the placenta removes from the walls of the womb. In the third trimester, the walls of the womb become thinner and spread to give room to the growing fetus. If placenta previa is present, the placenta is attached very low on the womb wall. This thinning of the walls of the womb makes the placenta stretch and tear away from the wall of the womb, leading to bleeding. The possible complications of placenta previa: 
a)Infection and formation of blood clots 
b)Unborn baby has pain due to low oxygen supply
c)Slow growth of the baby due to insufficient blood supply 
d)Shock and death of the mother if the bleeding is too much
e)Baby may have anemia

mother.name: Management of Placenta Previa
mother.content: To reduce bleeding and complications, the mother should have complete bed rest possibly in the hospital. Also, pelvic examinations or any sexual activity that may lead to irritation of the cervix or the uterine walls should be avoided.If the diagnoses indicate complete placenta previa, your doctor may advise a cesarean section for the delivery of the baby. This is because normal delivery might result in the placenta tearing and bleeding, thereby putting the mother and the baby at risk.

mother.name: What Food Can A Mother With Low Blood After Delivery Take?
mother.content:
a)Oatmeal- Oatmeal is a very good source of iron which is essential for mothers who have anemia after pregnancy. Research has shown that anemia can cause a low level of breast milk flow. Oatmeal is easy to make, and because it contains iron, it helps to build blood.
b)Garlic- Garlic is good food that contributes to increasing breast milk production in mothers. Garlic also makes your food taste better. 
c)Green Pawpaw- Eating unripe pawpaw helps in increasing the production of breast milk. You can boil it and eat it. 
d)Carrots- Carrots can also help with breastfeeding; Carrot contains Vitamin A which is necessary for your baby's growth.
e)Spinach- It is also a good source of iron, but you should boil it before eating. 
f)Nuts- Nuts such as groundnut, cashew, etc. help with the production of breast milk.

mother.name: What Causes Bleeding After Delivery?
mother.content:
After a baby is delivered, the womb normally continues to reduce in size by tightening the muscle of the womb so that the placenta can be pushed out. After the placenta comes out, the tightening of the muscle helps reduce the bleeding in the womb. If the uterus does not shrink strongly enough the bleeding will continue. This is the most common cause of bleeding after delivery. Sometimes if small pieces of the placenta remain attached to the womb, bleeding can happen. Some things can make bleeding to happen after delivery. They are;
a)The placenta removes early from the womb
b)The placenta is covering the opening of the womb
c)The womb is too large
d)High blood pressure during pregnancy
e)Many deliveries of babies before
f)Long labor
g)Obesity
h)Use of medicine to cause labor
i)Infection
j)Use of medicine to stop labor
k)Use of forceps or vacuum-assisted delivery
l)General anesthesia
m)Cut in the womb
n)Blood not clotting

mother.name: Child Spacing
mother.content:
Key facts on child spacing;
a)214 million women of reproductive age in developing countries who want to avoid pregnancy are not using a modern child spacing method.
b)Some child spacing methods, such as condoms, help prevent the transmission of HIV and other sexually transmitted infections.
c)Child spacing reduces the need for abortion, especially unsafe abortion.
d)Child spacing reinforces people's rights to determine the number and spacing of their children.
e)By preventing unintended pregnancy, child spacing prevents deaths of mothers and children. Child spacing allows people to attain their desired number of children and determine the spacing of pregnancies. It is achieved through the use of pregnancy prevention methods and the treatment of infertility. (See Benefits of child spacing, Pregnancy prevention methods under General Health.)

mother.name: What is the most effective type of birth control?
mother.content: Some factors determine the effectiveness of the birth control method. The factors include; age of the woman, health condition such as heart diseases, high blood pressure, cancer, etc., your choice, whether the woman is breastfeeding or not.

general_health.name: What Is Colostrum?
general_health.content: Colostrum is the first breast milk that comes out of the breast after delivery of a baby. It is produced in the breast during pregnancy before the baby is born. Colostrum is low in volume but very good in building immunity to disease. The colostrum is made in the breasts a long time before a baby is born. Naturally, after the birth milk begins to be produced. Colostrum will come first after you start to put the baby to the breast.

general_health.name: Why Does My Heart Beat Fast For No Reason?
general_health.content:
When the heart beats fast for no reason, it may not be serious, and it will go away by itself. But it may be a symptom of something serious. A fast heartbeat may be because of the following;
a)  Anemia
b)  Damage to heart tissues from heart disease
c)  Abnormal heart waves from birth
d)  Disease of the heart
e)  Exercise
f)  Smoking
g)  Sudden stress, such as fright
h)  Fever
i)  High or low blood pressure
j)  Drinking too much alcohol
k)  The side effect of some medicines
l)  Drinking too many soft drinks, energy drink, tea, coffee, energy shots, and some fruit or fruit-flavored and water drinks. Also, taking too much ice-cream, Kolanut, and chocolate.
m)  Drugs abuse
n)Overactive thyroid

general_health.name: What Causes Fear?
general_health.content: Fear occurs when a person feels threatened. Fear is a natural emotion that helps our bodies to respond to danger by responding with a fight or running away from it.  So, fear is important to keep us safe.

general_health.name: What Causes Eye Infections Or Pains?
general_health.content: Eye infection can be caused can be germs. The signs of eye infections include; pain, tears dropping from the eyes, feeling that something is in the eyes, the eye is itching, small swelling under the eyelid or below the eyelashes, feeling of peppery and the eye is painful when there a light or it is bright.

general_health.name: What Causes Jaundice In Adults?
general_health.content: Jaundice is when the white part of the eye and skin is yellow in color. It is a sign of disease of the liver, gallbladder, pancreas or blood. Jaundice occurs when there is too much waste product of destroyed red blood cell in the blood.

general_health.name: What Causes Chest cold?
general_health.content:
Chest cold is when the lungs and the part of the body use for breathing are infected with germs. Chest cold is common in cold weather. It usually starts with a cough. The symptoms of chest cold include; mucus from the nose, mild headache, watery eyes, and sore throat. Chest cold is common among, pregnant women, people who smoke, elderly and young children, people who have low ability to fight diseases such as people who have cancer, asthma, heart diseases, etc.
You can prevent chest cold by covering your mouth correctly every time you sneeze, wash your hands regularly.  Do not use tissue over and over again. Throw away used tissue papers on time.

general_health.name: How to treat chest cold
general_health.content:
You can treat chest cold by doing the following;
a)Gargle with salt water- Steps- mix one tablespoon of salt into warm water. Mix it well inside a glass and let salt get appropriately dissolved. Gargle with this mixture at least 2 or 3 times a day.
b)Breathe in the steam- Steps- Put boiling water inside a bowl and mix few drops of peppermint oil or eucalyptus essential oil into it. Put a towel over your head and bring your face close to the warm water, Inhale this steam for few minutes and it will clear your nose. Take warm water for bathing. Note: pregnant women, young children and people who have severe heart disease or high blood pressure should not use this method.
c)Use Apple Cider Vinegar- Apple cider vinegar is very useful in improving the body's ability to fight disease. Steps- Mix two teaspoons of unfiltered, natural raw Apple Cider Vinegar with warm water. Add one teaspoon of raw honey. Drink this mixture least two or three times a day, for at least one week.
d)Use Ginger- Steps- Take one tablespoon of chopped raw ginger and mix it inside a hot water in a cup and cover the cup. Let the ginger stay inside for 5 minutes. Next, add a small amount of honey to the mixture. Drink at least 3 cups of this mixture per day. Or, grind dry ginger, cloves, and black pepper together and consume this mixture in three different doses per day with milk or honey.
e)Use Tumeric- Steps- Take some turmeric powder and get it mixed inside warm water in a cup. Gargle with this mixture for at least 2 or 3 times a day. You can also mix turmeric powder into milk and then boil it. Then add two teaspoons of honey and a small amount of black pepper. Drink this hot mixture at least 3 times a day. A combination of apple cider vinegar and turmeric powder also works very well.

general_health.name: What Causes Sudden Convulsion?
general_health.content: Convulsions are usually caused by some sort of electrical activity disturbance in the brain. Many times, the cause of convulsion is now known. Chemicals in the blood can cause convulsions, head injury as well as infections like meningitis. A common cause of convulsions is a fever.  Another cause is a stroke, lack of oxygen to the brain, birth defects, and brain tumors. Convulsions can also be caused by diabetes when blood sugar is too low or when the blood sugar is too high. The deficiency of vitamin B6 can also cause convulsions.

general_health.name: What Is Insomnia?
general_health.content:
Insomnia is difficulty in falling asleep or staying asleep, even when a person has the opportunity to sleep. People with insomnia may be happy with their sleep and usually experience one or more of the following symptoms: fatigue, low energy, difficulty concentrating, mood disturbances, and decreased performance in work or at school.
Inadequate sleep may be because of one or more of the following:
a)  Difficulty falling asleep
b)  Tiredness
c)  Waking up frequently during the night
d)  Low energy
e)  Having a problem in returning to sleep
f)  Difficulty in concentrating
g)  Unrefreshing sleep
h)  Low performance at school or work
i)  Mood disturbances

general_health.name: HELLP Syndrome ?
general_health.content: HELLP is the short form of 3 dangerous problems with blood level, liver problem. This illness is severe and can threaten the life of a person. HELLP can be a result of serious preeclampsia. The symptoms of  HELLP are nausea, vomiting, headache, and upper stomach pain. HELLP syndrome can cause severe damage to the organs systems so, emergency medical care is to reduce the blood pressure of the mother to protect her and the baby's health. In some cases, premature delivery is needed.

general_health.name: What Causes Of Ear Pain?
general_health.content:
Ear pain can be caused by an ear infection, injury or inflammation. The ear infection is the most common cause of ear pain. Another cause of ear pain are;
a)  Change in air pressure, such as when flying on a plane
b)  Ear wax buildup
c)  Shampoo or water inside the ear
d)  A foreign object in the ear
e)  A sore throat
f)  Use of cotton swabs in the ear
g)  Tooth problems
h)  Braces in the teeth
i)  Perforated eardrum
j)  Arthritis affecting the jaw

general_health.name: What Is Constipation?
general_health.content:
Constipation is when it is hard to pass feces or you don't pass feces as often as you should. Constipation is a common problem that is not usually serious.
The normal number of times people pass feces is different from person to person. Some people can pass feces up to three times a day while some other persons may pass feces few times in a week.
It is normal for a person not to pass feces for three days or more. It causes the poop to be hard and it gets harder every day, and it becomes more difficult to pass it out.
The Symptoms of Constipation are; not going to the toilet often, trouble passing feces, hard or small stools, a feeling that not all the poop came, swollen stomach

general_health.name: Causes Of Constipation
general_health.content:
Constipation can occur when you;
a)  Change the food that you eat or your physical activities
b)  Do not take enough water 
c) Do not take enough fiber in your food
d) Eat a lot of dairy products
e) Are not active
f)  Stop the in the urge to poop
g)  Stress
h)  Overuse drugs that make you purge
i) Use some medications such as anti-depression drugs and iron pills
j) Use Antacid medicines that contain aluminum and calcium 
k)  Have a problem with eating 
l) Have stomach that easily upset
m)  Pregnant 
n) Problem with the nerves muscles in your digestion system
o)  Colon cancer

general_health.name: Acne
general_health.content:
Acne is a skin disease that happens when the sweat pores are blocked with dead skin cells oil from the skin. It is common on the face, upper back, shoulders, forehead and chest, upper back. Acnes have blackheads or whiteheads, pimples and usually appears on the face. Acne is most common among teenagers, but it affects people of different ages.
It is difficult for Acne to clear because it heals slowly and as one is going away another one is coming. It causes scar on the skin. Acne can be treated.

general_health.name: Symptoms Of Acne
general_health.content:
Acne signs depending on how severe the condition is:
Whiteheads (closed, blocked pores)
Blackheads (open blocked pore)
Pimples which are papules with pus at their tips
Big, solid, painful lumps under the surface of the skin 
Painful, lumps filled with pus under the surface of the skin.

general_health.name: Causes Of Acne
general_health.content:
The factors that cause acne are:
a)  Excessive oil production
b)  Bacteria
c)  Sweat pores blocked by oil and dead skin cells
d)  An excess reaction of a type of hormone.

general_health.name: What Is Pneumonia?
general_health.content:
Pneumonia is a lung infection makes a person feel very sick.  The signs of Pneumonia are; a cough, fever, and finding it difficult to breathe. Most Pneumonia can be treated at home. It often heals in 2 to 3 weeks. Elderly person babies, a person with other diseases can become very ill. They may need to be in the hospital.
A person can get pneumonia in everyday life, such as at school or walk.  Also, pneumonia can be contacted in the hospital or nursing home. It may be more severe if a person is already are ill.

general_health.name: What Causes Pneumonia?
general_health.content:
Germs cause pneumonia
Pneumonia starts when a person breathes the germs into the lung. Pneumonia is common get after a person has a cold. The diseases make it hard for the lungs to fight the infection, so it is easier to get Pneumonia. Someone who has a long-term illness like asthma, cancer, heart disease, or diabetes is more likely to get Pneumonia.

general_health.name: What Is The Symptoms Pneumonia?
general_health.content:
Symptoms of Pneumonia comes quickly. They include:
a) A cough with mucus. The mucus may be green or with blood.
b) Feeling very tired or very weak.
c)  Fever.
d)  Fast breathing and feeling short of breath.
e) Shaking and `teethâ€“chattering` cold.
f)  Fast heartbeat
g)  Nausea and vomiting
h) Chest pain that feels worse when a person coughs or breathe in.
h) Chest pain that feels worse when a person coughs or breathe in.
i) Diarrhea

general_health.name: Treatment For Pneumonia
general_health.content:
Your health provider will give medicine depending on the cause of pneumonia. Make sure that you use all the drugs according to the way you were told to use it. Do not stop taking the drug until you finish it even if you feel better
The doctor can give antibiotics or another medicine depending on the type of germ that caused pneumonia.  Take the antibiotics exactly as you were told. You should not stop taking the drugs just because you feel better.
Pneumonia can make you feel very sick. However, after you take antibiotics, you should start to feel much better.
To help the person feel better during treatment, you should plenty of rest and sleep, and drink lots of liquids. Do not smoke.

general_health.name: How Can You Prevent Pneumonia?
general_health.content: The best way to prevent pneumonia in child and adult is by immunization. The regular immunization of babies includes vaccination against pneumonia. Stay away from people who have a cold, measles and chickenpox. Wash your hands regularly to prevent the spread of germs.

general_health.name: How To Wash Hands Properly
general_health.content:
Proper hand washing is an effective method of making hands, nails clean and free of germs. Proper hand washing is also the gateway to good health.
Proper hand washing is an effective method of making hands, nails clean and free of germs. Proper hand washing is also the gateway to good health.
Materials for washing hands properly: 
a)  Clean water running water
b) Soap
c)  Clean towel/clothe/ tissue paper.:WHO: How to handwash? With soap and water

general_health.name: Steps To Wash Hands Properly:
general_health.content:
a.  Wet your hands with water
b.  Apply soap and water to the hands until foam comes out
c. Wash your hand's palm to palm
d. Wash between fingers
e.  Wash the back of fingers
f.  Wash the back of your hands
g.  Wash the base of your thumbs
h. Wash your fingernails
i. Wash the two wrists
j. Rinse and air dry or use a clean towel clothing to dry hands

general_health.name: Importance of proper hand washing:
general_health.content: It improves your health and wellbeing. It helps in making the hands free from germs. It prevents you from putting things that you do not want into your body. It reduces the risks of getting diseases such as Ebola, and cholera. It saves lives and preventing sickness.WHO: How to handwash? With soap and water

general_health.name: When To Wash Hands:
general_health.content:
a)  After sport or playing outside
b)  After work
c)  After sneezing/coughing
d) After excretion using the toilet
e) After playing with pets
f) Before and after cooking
g)  Before and after eating
h) Before touching or feeding your kids
Caution:
- Do not share a towel with anybody and always use a clean cloth to wipe your hands after washing.
- When using tap remember to use tissue paper to close or lock the tap, to not get the germs back to your hands
- Always wash the basin and make the surrounding tidy always
- Cut your nails so that your hands remove germs easily.
- If there is no tap water, get someone to pour the water or make a hole or tap on the water container.
- Don't wash hands with water that have been used for washing hands by others.

general_health.name: Personal Hygiene
general_health.content: Personal hygiene is a way of maintaining cleanliness and grooming of the external body.  It is very important to a person's health, so parents should teach their children to have the habit of basic personal hygiene. Parents should do this by their example.

general_health.name: Basic Personal Hygiene:
general_health.content:
a)  Bath regularly
b)  Always wash your hands with soap and water after using the toilet, before eating and before cooking (Check when to wash your hands).
c)  Do not walk about without shoes and allow children to do so.
d)  Brush your teeth twice daily, in the morning and at night.
e)  Do not let goats or other animals come into the house or places where children play
f)  Do not allow dogs to lick children or climb up on beds
g)  Clean the house often
h)  Wash and hangs/spread clothes, sheets and blankets in the sun regularly.

general_health.name: Reasons Why You Have Good Personal Hygiene:
general_health.content:
a)  It reduces the risks of having infectious diseases
b)  It reduces the number of times that you get sick.
c)  It reduces the amount of money spent on health care 
d)  It increases self-esteem because a clean person feels much better about himself. 
e)  It improves acceptance of a person in the society
f)  It will help parents to be a role model for their children

general_health.name: What Is Tuberculosis?
general_health.content: Tuberculosis is caused by a germ that spreads from person to person through the air. Tuberculosis can spread when someone with the untreated, active form of tuberculosis coughs, speaks, sneezes, spits, laughs or sings.

general_health.name: Signs And Symptoms Of Tuberculosis Include:
general_health.content:
a)  Coughing that is up to 2 or more weeks
b)  Tiredness
c) Coughing up blood
d) Night sweat
e) Chest pain
f)  Loss of appetite
g)  Unintentional weight loss
h) Fever
i) Cold.

general_health.name: What Causes Dizziness?
general_health.content: Dizziness can be caused by many things such disturbance in the inner ear disturbance, infection, and injury in the ear, poor health. Other causes of dizziness include anxiety problem, low iron level in the blood, low blood sugar, hot weather, and not taking enough water.

general_health.name: Irregular Menstruation
general_health.content: It is common for menstruation to be irregular sometimes especially during early maturity and menopause. Painful menstruation is something you should report to your doctor.

general_health.name: Causes Of Irregular Menstruation
general_health.content:
a)  Thyroid disorder- the thyroid controls the hormones that control the breakdown of things in the body. When there is a problem with the thyroid, it can lead to irregular menstruation. There are two types of thyroid disorders: an underactive and an overactive thyroid. The symptoms of underactive thyroid are weight gain, tiredness, sensitivity to cold and depression. The symptoms of an overactive thyroid are weight loss, anxiety, swelling in the throat area. The doctor should diagnose this condition, and he will prescribe treatment.
b) Polycystic ovary syndrome- This is when cysts grow in the ovaries. This prevents the release of eggs from ovary so the woman will miss her periods or have light irregular menstruations. Sometimes these women grow hair on their faces.
c) Cancer- Cancer can cause irregular menstruation. Irregular menstruation is a sign of cervical cancer. If you have irregular menses, go and do a test for cervical cancer.
d) Extreme weight loss or gain- when a woman loses or gains weight quickly it can cause irregular menstruation. See your health provider discuss if your current weight is healthy for you. Make sure that you are getting enough nutrients while watching your weight.
e)  Stress- is common for women to have irregular menstruation when they have stress. This is because a high level of stress leads to an imbalance in hormones in the body.

general_health.name: Benefits Of Child Spacing
general_health.content:
a)  It ensures access to child spacing methods for women and couples. It improves the health and wellbeing of women and the development of communities.
b)  It prevents health risk from pregnancy in women- when a woman can choose if and when she wants to get pregnant it can have an impact on her health. Child spacing prevents pregnancy that is not wanted. It helps women to determine the size of the family that they want. 
c)  It reduces the need for unsafe abortion because it reduces unwanted pregnancy.
d)  It reduces the death of babies because when babies are born close to one another, they are at high risk of dying early. It also reduces the risk of the mother dying due to health problems from pregnancy.
e)  It helps to prevent HIV/AIDS because women who have HIV that may transfer the HIV to their baby. Also, when people use condoms, they prevent the transfer of HIV and other sexually transmitted infections. 
f)  It empowers people to make personal choices on their sexual and reproductive health. It also allows women to get more education and get employed because they are not caring for many children. Also, the family can get more resources to send their few children to school. 
g)  It reduces pregnancy among young people (adolescents). Young girls that get pregnant are at a high-risk health problem from pregnancy. Their babies are often small and premature. Young girls who get pregnancy often do not continue school. The effect of early pregnancy of young girls is long term on them their families and communities. 
h)  It reduces the rate of population growth in the community and country. When the population growth is not too fast then the negative effect on the economy and environment is reduced.

general_health.name: Modern Methods Pregnancy Prevention
general_health.content:
a)  Combined oral contraceptives (COCs) also called 'the pill'- It contains two types of hormones. It works by preventing the release of eggs from the ovaries. It prevents pregnancy by 99% if you use it correctly every time. It also prevents some cancers such as ovarian cancer.
b)  Progestogen-only pills (POPs) also called 'the minipill'- It contains only one hormone. It works by making the mucus in the cervix thick to block sperm and egg from meeting. It also prevents the release of eggs. It prevents pregnancy by 99% if you use it correctly every time. You can use it while breastfeeding. Note that it must be taken at the same time each day.
c)  Emergency pills â€“ is a pill that is used to prevent pregnancy up to 5 days after you have sex without pregnancy prevention. It works by delaying the release of the egg into the womb. It can be used to prevent pregnancy from rape. Note that it does not disturb any pregnancy that is already in the womb.
d)  Implants are Small, flexible rods or capsules that ate placed under the skin of the upper arm. It contains a hormone. It works by making the mucus in the cervix thick to block sperm and egg from meeting. It prevents pregnancy by 99%. It can be inserted and removed by a healthcare worker. It can be used up to 3 to 5 years depending on the number of years of the implant. It can make you bleed, but it is not harmful.
e)  Intrauterine device (IUD) also known as Copper T or Coil- it has a shape like T. It is put into the womb. It works by releasing copper or depending on the type it may release a small amount of hormone every day that prevents pregnancy. The hormone makes the wall of the womb thick and blocks the sperm from meeting the egg. It prevents pregnancy by 99%. If it Copper it can make the menstrual period to be longer or heavier. If it has hormone, it can stop menstruation and reduce painful menstruation.
f)  Injectables- it can be every month or every 2 or 3 months depending on the type. It works if it is the monthly kind- by making the mucus of the vagina thick and it blocks the sperm from meeting the egg. Or if it is the 2- 3 months type it works by preventing the egg from coming into the womb.  It prevents pregnancy by 99%. It can cause the menstruation not to be regular.
g)  Male condom- looks like rubber and it is used to cover the penis. It works by blocking the sperm from entering into the vagina. It prevents pregnancy up to 98%. It also prevents sexually transmitted diseases. Note that for a male condom to be effective, you have to wear it correctly every time you want to have sex.
h)  Female condom- looks like rubber and it is put inside the vagina of a woman. It works by blocking the sperm from entering into the vagina. It prevents pregnancy up to 90%. It also prevents sexually transmitted diseases
i)  Male sterilization- it is the permanent blocking of the tube that carries sperm from the scrotum to the penis. It works by removing the sperm for the fluid that carries. It effective after 3 months of sperm release.  It prevents pregnancy by 99%. It does not work after the sexual ability of the male. Note that since it permanent and it cannot be changed when a person does it.  He should be told everything about male sterilization before he decides voluntarily.
j)  Female sterilization- it is the permanent blocking of the tube that carries egg into the womb. It works by blocking the egg from meeting the sperm. It prevents pregnancy by 99%. It does not work after the sexual ability of the female. Note that since it permanent and it cannot be changed is a person does it. She must be told everything about female sterilization before she decides voluntarily.

general_health.name: Traditional Pregnancy Prevention Methods
general_health.content:
a)Exclusive Breastfeeding Method â€“ is a temporary natural pregnancy prevention method for women who just delivered babies and the monthly menstrual period has not started again. It works when a mother breastfeeds the baby that is less than 6 months old day and night without giving the baby any other food. It prevents the eggs to be released into the womb. It would prevent pregnancy up to 99% if it used correctly and continuously. Note it that does not work for every woman, and it tends to depend on your heredity of the trait. 
b)Calendar method- it uses the calendar to calculate the days when the woman is fertile. It prevents pregnancy for up to 91%. The day that women starts to menstruate is Day 1. You will count to Day 12 after the menstruation and up to Day 16 after the menses. The Day 12 to Day 16 after menstruation is the days when the woman can get pregnant if she has sex without prevention. This means that the total number of days that the woman can get pregnant is 5 days each month.  The way you arrive at the 5 days is that a woman's egg will come into her womb the 14th after her menstruation starts. So, she can get pregnant that day. The egg will live for 2 days that means she can get pregnant 2 days after her egg comes into the womb. Then if you add that 2 days to the 14th day you will get the 16th day. However, a male sperm will live for 2 days in the womb before it dies. It means that if a woman has sex without prevention 2 days before her eggs come, then she can still get pregnant. So, you remove 2 days from the 14th day after menstruation you will get the 12th day.  Note that to calculate it, the date in the calendar is not what you are counting. It is the day. Hence for example, if your menstruation starts on Monday, July 23, 2018, you will count that Monday as Day 1, and you will count it until you get Day 12 which is Friday, August 3, 2018.
