Then you will continue to the 16th Day which is Tuesday, August 6, 2018. Therefore, from Friday, August 3 to Tuesday, August 6, 2018, you must prevent yourself from getting pregnant. Please note that the calculation is the same for every woman even if your menstrual cycle is 25 day or 32 days. But it does not work well for women with menstruation that is not regular. 
c)Removal Method- the man removes his penis from the vagina and release the sperm outside away from the woman's vagina. It prevents fertilization up to 96%. Note that it is not easy for the man to always know when to remove the penis on time. It can make the man to release inside the vagina.

general_health.name: Mouth Odor And Treatment
general_health.content:
The most common cause of mouth odor is poor oral hygiene. Mouth odor is also a sign of some diseases. Simple home remedies and change in lifestyle can solve this problem. If you have a mouth odor go to the doctor to know of the cause.
There are different types of mouth odor depending on the cause. To know if you have mouth odor ask a family or friend to access your mouth odor. To access it yourself, lick your wrist, leave it to dry and then smell it.

general_health.name: Treatment Of Mouth Odor
general_health.content:
The best method to treat mouth odor is good oral hygiene. Good oral hygiene includes
a)  Brushing to your teeth twice a day.
b) Remove residues from between the teeth.
c) Change your toothbrush every three months.
d)  Use toothpaste the contains fluorine and antibacterial properties.
e)  Go to the dentist for a check-up and cleaning twice in a year. These practices will help you to avoid tooth decay.  
f)  Brush tongue: Bacteria, food, and dead cells usually build upon the tongue, especially in smokers or those have a very dry mouth. Use a tongue scraper if necessary
g)  Avoid dry mouth: Drink plenty of water. Avoid alcohol and tobacco because they dehydrate the mouth. Chewing gum or sucking a sweet, preferably sugar-free, can help increase the production of saliva. Or visit a doctor who may prescribe medication that stimulates the flow of saliva.
h)  Diet: Eat breakfast that includes rough foods can help clean the back of the tongue. Avoid onions, garlic, and spicy food. Sugary foods are also linked to bad breath. Reduce coffee and alcohol consumption.

general_health.name: Common Causes Of Mouth Odorr
general_health.content:
a)  Tobacco: Tobacco products cause some types of mouth odor. Also, they increase the chances of gum disease which can also cause bad breath.
b)  Food: Food particles that remain stuck in the teeth can cause odors. Some foods such as onions and garlic can also cause bad breath. This is because after they are digested, their breakdown products are carried in the blood to the lungs where they can affect the breath.
c)  Dry mouth: the mouth is cleaned naturally by Saliva. If the mouth is dry, mouth odor can build up.
d)  Dental hygiene: Brushing and flossing ensure the removal of small particles of food that can build up and slowly break down, producing odor. A film of bacteria called plaque builds up if brushing is not regular. This plaque can irritate the gums and cause swelling between the teeth and gums. Dentures that are not cleaned regularly or properly can also harbor bacteria that cause halitosis.
e)  Crash diets: Fasting and eating low-carbohydrate can produce bad mouth odor. This is because the body will be breaking down fats. This process produces a chemical product that has a strong aroma.
f)  Drugs: Some medications can reduce saliva and, therefore, increase mouth odor. Other drugs can produce odors as they break down and release chemicals in the breath. People who take vitamin supplements in large doses can be prone to bad mouth odor.
g)  Mouth, nose, and throat infections: Sometimes bacteria-covered stones can form on the tonsils at the back of the throat and produce odor. Also, infections or inflammation in the nose, throat, or sinuses can cause mouth odor.
h)  Foreign body: Bad odor can be caused by something in the nasal cavity, especially in children.
i)  Diseases: Some diseases such as cancers, liver failure, and other metabolic diseases can cause bad odor because of some chemicals that they produce.

general_health.name: What is Toilet Infection?
general_health.content:
The appropriate term for toilet disease is a vaginal infection. Symptoms of vaginal infections include swelling of the vagina, bad odor, itching, irritation, discharge of mucus (whitish or yellowish) and pain sometimes.
There are different kinds of vaginal infections including Gonorrhea, Chlamydia, vagina yeast infection, a bacterial infection. The symptoms of different vaginal infections look alike so it important that you go for a laboratory test to know the type of disease you have.

general_health.name: The Symptoms Of Toilet Infection
general_health.content:
Bacterial Vaginosis (BV)
a) Abnormal vaginal discharge with a bad odor (it smells like fish) often after intercourse
b)  Discharge may be thin with gray or white color
c) Itching around the vagina
d) Burning during urination
e) Some women may not have any symptoms
Note that you do not get Bacterial Vaginosis from bedsheets, toilet seats, and swimming pools. BV is common in the following conditions;
a) Smoking
b) Pregnancy
c) Frequent douching
d) Use of an Intrauterine device (IUD)
e) Having more than one sexual partner or a new sexual partner
f) Vaginal Yeast Infection
g) Vaginal discharge is thick, whitish-gray (it looks like cottage cheese) in color
h) Painful urination and painful intercourse
i) Strong itching around the vagina
Note that Vaginal Yeast infection is common in the following conditions.
a) Antibiotics: Using antibiotics may destroy the protective bacteria in the vagina causing overgrowth of yeast.
b) Birth control pills: This is capable of interfering with the hormone balance of the body thereby promoting the growth of fungi in the vagina
c) Hormonal changes such as in pregnancy, ovulation, menopause: All of these things can create a good environment for the multiplication of germs within the vagina
d) Medical Condition: Such as diabetes and weak immune system may increase the risk of yeast infection
Trichomoniasis
a) Foamy vaginal discharge with gray or yellowish green color
b) Burning during urination
c) Itching or irritation of the vagina
d) Bad smell
e) Discomfort during intercourse
f) Symptoms occur within 4 to 20 days after the first contact because it is a sexually transmitted disease
Note Trichomoniasis is a sexually transmitted disease that is common among women.
Non-Infectious Vaginitis- Sometimes there can be symptoms of in the vaginal that is not caused by infections. The symptoms include itching, vaginal discharge, and burning feeling. Menopause or the removal of ovaries may cause it. It is also be caused by an allergic reaction to some products. They include;
a) Detergents
b) Vaginal sprays
c) Spermicide
d) Pant Liners
e) Perfumed soaps
f) Fabric softeners
g) Tampon left in the vagina

general_health.name: Home Remedy of Vaginal Infections
general_health.content:
Bacterial Vaginosis (BV) â€“ The regular treatment of BV is antibiotics. Flagyl is also useful for treating it. Home remedies for bacterial vaginosis include;
a)  Garlic: Peel off the skin and insert this into the vagina allowing it to remain overnight. This may be done once every day until the infection goes away.
b)  Apple cider vinegar: This is another effective natural remedy for vaginal infections. Mix a tablespoon of apple cider vinegar with two cups of water and add a fresh clove of garlic. Allow the solution to stand for some time so that the nutrient in the garlic can be absorbed and then use it for douching.
Vaginal Yeast Infection- Vaginal creams are very useful for treating mild cases of vaginal yeast infection. Recurrent and severe cases can be treated with vaginal clotrimazole and oral fluconazole used according to prescription. Do not douche because it makes the disease spread into the cervix and womb.
Avoid douching when you have a vaginal yeast infection as douching may promote the yeast infection and spread it to the cervix and into the uterus.

general_health.name: Home Remedies For Yeast Infection
general_health.content:
a)Yogurt: A common home remedy for yeast infections is to immerse a tampon in yogurt and insert it into the vagina. This may be done twice every day until the symptoms subside. 
b)Garlic: Peel off the skin and insert the garlic overnight. Use it every night until the infection goes away.  It is an effective home remedy. 
c)Tea Tree Oil: Tea tree oil helps to ease the symptoms of itching and irritation caused by a yeast infection. Pour a few drops of the oil on a tampon and put it inside the vagina.

general_health.name: Prevention Of Vaginal Infection (Toilet Disease)
general_health.content:
a)  Always keep yourself clean and dry
b)  Avoid using vaginal sprays or heavily perfumed soaps on the vagina.
c)  Be careful not to allow the transfer of germs from the anal area while wiping
d)  Avoid wearing clothes that withhold heat and moisture such as nylon underwear, tight jeans,  and pantyhose without cotton.
e)  Using condoms may help prevent transmitting infections
f)  Eating yogurt with active cultures may help reduce vaginal yeast infections
g)  Don't use deodorant tampons or pads
h)  Remaining in a sweaty or dirty cloth can worsen the infection
i)  Try to get a complete gynecologic exam every year.

general_health.name: Cause Of Itching After Bath, Prevention And Remedy
general_health.content: Itching is a way the body responds to skin surface irritation. It is a natural warning to remove what is irritating you before damage is done. The irritation can be from water, temperature, touch, and toiletries.

general_health.name: Causes Of Itching After Bathing
general_health.content:
a) Water: water can irritate if it remains for long on the body. Itching after bathing may be due to bathing for too long or not wiping the body dry completely
b)  Temperature: the temperature of The doctor should diagnose this problem. Water that is used for bathing may irritate. When the water is, it may burn the skin, cause pain and lead to itching. The itching is more intense if there is a minor skin injury before. The hot water will make the feeling worse. The hot water can, the skin too much such that the skin starts itching.
c)  Toiletries: regular toiletries such as toothpaste, soap, and shampoo can irritate the skin when it touches the skin. If you brush the teeth while in the shower it can cause the toothpaste to fall to other parts of the body. It will irritate the skin if it is not thoroughly removed. 
d)  Scrubbing: scrubbing the body vigorously with hard sponge cause injury on the skin and lead to itching. 
e)  Hypersensitivity: when a person's skin is hypersensitive, and the skin scrubbed hard and heat it causes itching.
f)  Infections- there may be some microorganism in the water which may infect the skin during bathing.

general_health.name: How To Prevent Skin Itching
general_health.content:
a)Use mild soap and shampoo- use regular soap or baby soap- Avoid using antiseptic soap. Make sure that you rinse all the soap and shampoo that you use for bathing off your body. Rinse your body on time once you apply soap or shampoo. 
b)Bath with lukewarm water for a short period- Avoid bathing for long and using boiling water to bathe. 
c)Scrub the body gently when bathing- avoid scrubbing your body hard. All the dead cells on the body will fall on their own. 
d)Dry the skin thoroughly after bathing- use a dry towel to wipe the body. Allow air to dry the body for a short period before wearing clothes. 
e)Apply body cream on the dry skin after bathing. Make sure that the skin is dried thoroughly before applying a body cream. Always use non-scented body creams if your skin is sensitive.

general_health.name: How to Ease Skin Itching
general_health.content:
a) Bath again for a short period still with normal water. Rub the body with your hand. Do not use a sponge or other rough object to scrub the skin. Dry the skin thoroughly the bath.
b) Air dry for longer. If you have an electric fan or air conditioning, then try to cool down before putting on clothes. This should be avoided in cold environments as the body can lose heat rapidly after a hot bath.
c) Apply petroleum jelly (Vaseline) on the affected area. Do not use creams that have water until the itching stops.

general_health.name: High Blood Pressure
general_health.content:
High blood pressure, or hypertension, is defined as blood pressure higher than 140/90 mm Hg. The condition is a serious concern for some pregnant women.
High blood pressure during pregnancy isn't always dangerous. But it can sometimes cause severe health complications for both mother and developing a baby. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, an increasing number of pregnant women in the United States have this condition.

general_health.name: What Are The Causes Of Heart Attacks?
general_health.content:
A heart attack is when the flow of blood to the heart is blocked. The flow of blood to the heart can be blocked by an accumulation of fat, cholesterol and other materials. They become hard together and prevent blood flow to the heart. When blood is blocked in the heart, it causes damage, or it destroys part of the heart muscle.
The common cause of heart attack is;
a) Smoking.
b)  High cholesterol level
c)  Diabetes.
d) High blood pressure.
e)  Stress.
f) Obesity.
g)  Inactive lifestyle.
h) Eating too little fruits and vegetables.

general_health.name: What Is Birth Asphyxia?
general_health.content:
Asphyxia means lack of oxygen. Birth asphyxia happens when a baby's brain and other organs do not get enough oxygen before, during or right after birth. This can happen without anyone knowing. Without oxygen, cells cannot work correctly. Waste products (acids) build up in the cells and damage.
The level of harm from birth asphyxia depends on:
a) How long the baby does not get enough oxygen
b)  How low the level of oxygen is
c)  How quickly the right treatment is given.

general_health.name: Symptoms Of Birth Asphyxia
general_health.content:
Symptoms of asphyxia at the time of birth may include:
a)  Not breathing or very weak breathing
b)  Skin color that is blue, gray, or lighter than normal
c)  Low heart rate
d)  Poor muscle tone
e)  Weak reflexes
f)  Too much acid in the blood 
g)  Birth water fluid stained with first stool
h)  Seizures

general_health.name: Treatment of Birth Asphyxia
general_health.Content:
If your baby has mild asphyxia at birth, they will get breathing support until they can breathe well enough on their own. We watch them closely for signs of problems.
Babies with more serious asphyxia may need:
a)  A breathing machine
b)  Respiratory therapy
c)  Fluid
d)  Medicine to prevent seizures
e)  Using intravenous (IV) nutrition to give their intestine time to recover.

general_health.name: What Is HIV/AIDS?
general_health.content:
HIV means- Human Immunodeficiency Virus. It is a germ that targets the ability of the body to fight disease by making the body weak against infections. HIV weakens the body to the extent that the person can fall sick easily from common diseases that the body can fight.
The highest stage of HIV infection is Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS). It can take from 2 to 15 years for a person that has HIV to develop to AIDS. A person that has AIDS may have some cancers, infections and other severe health problems.
The symptoms of HIV depend on the stage of infection. The first signs of infection include fever, headache, sore throat and rash. Also, sometimes the person may not have any symptom. As the infection continues, the person will show other signs such as diarrhea, weight loss, and cough. If they do not treat these sicknesses, they can also have tuberculosis, meningitis, serious bacterial infections, and some cancers. 
HIV can be transmitted through the exchange of different body fluids from infected individuals to an uninfected person. The body fluid that can transfer HIV to another person is blood, breast milk, sperm, vaginal secretions, sharing sharp objects and organ transplant.  A person cannot get HIV infection through ordinary day-to-day contacts such as kissing, hugging, shaking hands, or sharing personal objects such as cloth, food or water.
The best way to prevent HIV is; Do not share a sharp object, Do not have sex, If you have sex, be faithful to one sexual partner and protect yourself with a condom if you do not know the HIV status of your partner.

general_health.name: What Is Cancer?
general_health.content:
Cancer is when the cells in the body start to grow abnormally, very fast and grow beyond their boundary. The cells begin to go to other parts of the body and other organs. Cancer is the general name of this disease, and it can affect any part of the body. Cancer be in various parts of the body including; lung, breast, skin, stomach, and prostate
Things that cause can cancer includes- asbestos, tobacco smoke, smoke from wood and charcoal, infections from some germs, bleaching cream, some chemicals, and aging.

general_health.name: What Is Cholera?
general_health.content:
Cholera is a serious diarrhea infection caused by eating or drinking food and water contaminated with the cholera germ. The symptoms of cholera are serious watery stooling. The stooling starts about 12 hours to 5 days after the person eats or drink contaminated food or water. Cholera can kill a person within few hours if not treated urgently.
To prevent cholera, you should cover all food and water from the fly, wash your hand regularly especially after handling feces. Wash your hand before you eat, keep your environment clean.

general_health.name: What Is Ebola?
general_health.Content: Ebola is a disease caused by a virus. When a person contacts Ebola, the sign will start to show 2 to 21 days after. The first symptoms of Ebola are the sudden fever, tiredness, muscle pain, headache, and sore throat. The next signs are, vomiting, stooling, skin rash, the sign of kidney and liver problem. There may also both internal and external bleeding that is blood coming from the gum and in the stools. Ebola is spread when a person contacts with the blood, organs and other bodily fluids of infected animals such as monkeys, chimpanzees, antelope, gorillas, fruit bats, and porcupines found sick or dead or in the forest. Also, burial ceremonies that involve direct contact with the body of the dead person can also lead to the spread of Ebola.

sex.name: What Could Be The Causes Of Rashes To Private Parts?
sex.content: The most common cause of rashes around the private parts is due to infection from germs. Rashes around the sex organs are sometimes due to water and coolness around the organs, and wearing tight and thick clothes for a long time. Rashes around sex organs may be due to an allergic reaction and sexually transmitted diseases.

sex.name: What is Syphilis?
sex.content:
Syphilis is an infection that often spreads through sex. The symptom of syphilis is a wound that is not painful around the sex organs, anus or mouth. Syphilis spreads from person to person through contact with the wound.
 There are different types of syphilis, but generally, syphilis remains in the body after the wounds have gone. Syphilis can be cured early, but if it is untreated, it may cause damage to the brain, heart and other organs.
 Syphilis can be transferred from a pregnant woman to an unborn baby. A newborn baby with syphilis usually does not have symptoms, but some babies have symptoms. The symptoms include deafness, teeth deformities, and deformed nose. 
 Some factors that makes a person likely to get syphilis includes; having sex with more than one partner, men who have sex with men, having sex without condoms and having HIV infection.

sex.name: Sexually Transmitted Infection
sex.content:
Sexually transmitted diseases (STDs) are infections that are transmitted from one person to another by sex. The causes of STDs are different types of germs. There are many more than 20 types of STDs, including
Chlamydia
Genital herpes
Gonorrhea
HIV/AIDS
HPV
Syphilis
Trichomoniasis
Most STDs affect both women and men, but often the health problems caused is more serious for women. If a pregnant woman has an STD, it can affect the health of the baby.
 Antibiotics can treat STDs caused by bacteria, yeast, or parasites. But there is no cure for STDs caused by a virus, but medicine can often help with the symptoms and control the disease.

sex.name: Does sex during pregnancy harm the baby?
sex.content: No, sex during pregnancy cannot harm the baby. The placenta and the womb muscles protect the baby. Also, there is a thick plug that covers the entrance of the womb which helps to guard against infections. The penis cannot get to the womb where the baby is.

sex.name: Can Having Sex Cause Premature Labor?
sex.content: No, having sex cannot cause labor. Sexual arousal or orgasm cannot start labor or cause miscarriage. Although orgasm can cause mild contractions temporarily. It is generally not harmful.

sex.name: Will Sex Feel Different Now That I Am Pregnant?
sex.content: Sex may feel different when you are pregnant. Your interest in sex may increase or decrease and it may become more pleasurable. This is because more blood flows into the sexual parts and makes it swollen. Sometimes it may be less pleasurable during some period of pregnancy. This may be due to your dislike of how the changes feel. During pregnancy, your breast may become soft and sensitive to touch. This may increase your sexual desire level, or you may not like it so it may decrease your sexual desire.

sex.name: Sex positions during pregnancy
sex.content:
Enjoying different sex positions during pregnancy is possible. Let your partner know if you feel uncomfortable, or experiencing pain in any style. 
 Below are some sex positions and how to practice it. Sex positions during pregnancy

sex.name: Is it Normal to have a low sex urges since I got pregnant?
sex.content: It is normal to have low sex urges during pregnancy. But do not be discouraged, your sexual urges may return to normal during the second trimester. Also, try to be less worried about your body and the baby. Please check Will sex feel different now that I'm pregnant?

sex.name: Is Oral Sex Safe When I'm Pregnant?
sex.content: Oral sex during pregnancy may not be safe in some instances. Do not allow blowing into your vagina. It is because it can cause an air bubble to get into your blood circulation. Although this occurs rarely, it is dangerous to you and the baby. Licking your partner penis is not safe if he has Sexually Transmitted Infections (STI) such as herpes. Also, if you have STI, he should not give you oral sex. If your partner is HIV positive do not do oral sex. It is because research shows that HIV can be transmitted through tiny cuts in a person's mouth and saliva. Ask your doctor if you have other questions.Ask Dr. Lisa Oral Sex During Pregnancy Medical Course
sex.link3: Ask Dr. Lisa Oral Sex During Pregnancy Medical Course

sex.name: How can I protect myself from Sexually Transmitted Infections (STI)?
sex.content:
You are at risk of STI if you have sex with more than one partner or your partner has sex with other people. So, to protect yourself and your partner you should do the following things. 1. Keep only one sexual partner 2. Use Condoms every time you want to have sex. Make sure you always wear the condom correctly every time you want to use it. 
 How to use condoms correctly

sex.name: Which are the best sexual positions when I'm pregnant?
sex.content: The best sex position during pregnancy is those that make you feel comfortable. To learn more, please check Sex positions during pregnancy.

sex.name: What kind of sign during sex should prompt a call to my doctor or midwife?
sex.content: When you are feeling anything that is not normal call your doctor.   It is normal to feel some tightness during or just after intercourse or orgasm.  If it the tightness doesn't go away after a few minutes, or if you have any pain or bleeding after sex, tell your doctor.

sibiling.name: Common Baby Skin Problems: Symptoms & Causes
sibiling.content:
Skin problems in a baby can be caused by germs, allergies, heat, and wet nappy. Most skin conditions do not last long.  Common skin conditions in babies include;
a) Heat rash- heat rash is also called prickly heat. Heat rash is caused by sweat that does not evaporate but remains under the skin. It looks likes small, pointed bumps and sometimes red. It often appears on the buttocks and the back. It is common in countries that are hot and humid.  Heat rash is caused by excessive sweat in hot weather, high fever, dressing the baby in cloths that are too warm or thick., wearing clothes that do not allow evaporation to take place and using heavy cream and ointments that blocks sweat pores.
b) The nappy rash-Nappy rash is common among babies, and it occurs more at age 9-12 months. The nappy rash looks red around the areas of the skin that are covered by diapers or nappy. Long contact with urine and stools causes it, the rubbing of fabric or sticky tapes, long use of diaper that is wet and infection from germs.
c) Cradle cap- are pink or red patches on the scalp. Sometimes it affects the armpit and the neck and it any be covered with white flakes or yellow scales. It is caused by bacterial infection and abnormal production of oil in the oil glands and hair follicles.
d)Eczema- are patches of red, itchy, rough and dry skin. It is found often on the check and legs of babies and children, sometimes adults have it. The real cause of Eczema is unknown some factors contribute to it. They are high temperature, viral infection, house dust mites, allergic reaction to detergents, soaps and creams.

sibiling.name: Prevention And Treatment of Baby Skin Conditions
sibiling.content:
Dress your child in light clothing depending on the weather, avoid using thick nappy especially in hot weather.  Do not use strong soap especially antiseptic baby soaps for the baby and do not use dyes for the baby clothing. Reduce the time used for bathing to about 5 -10 minutes. Use light cream to rub the skin of the baby.
a)Treatment for heat rash- Avoid thick nappy. Keep the room cool. Dress the baby in light clothes. Avoid thick body creams. Use cool water to bath the baby. Use heat rash
b)Treatment for nappy rash- change baby diaper on time. use water to wash the buttocks after changing nappy and use Vaseline to rub the buttocks. Use prescribed creams for treatment of serious cases.
c)Treatment for cradle cap- Put olive oil on the baby's head one hour before you bath the baby. It will help to make the scales soft before bathing. Use medicated shampoo to wash baby's head. Use prescribed treatment cream on the head for serious cases.
d)Treatment for eczema- bathe the baby with slightly warm water and mild soap. Do not rub the skin of the baby when drying it, pat it dry. Use body cream daily to prevent and control the spread of eczema. Use prescribed treatment cream.

sibiling.name: Causes Of Fever And High Temperature In Children
sibiling.content:
The normal range of temperature for children is 36.5Â°C-38Â°C. A fever is when the child's body temperature is higher than 38Â°C. A fever is a sign of sickness not an illness in itself. Fever is a natural response of the body to fight disease.
 Many things can make children to get fevers, and the fever may last for only a few days. But sometimes a fever may be longer, and it might be the symptom of a serious disease. The most common cause of fever in children is an infection.

sibiling.name: Symptoms Of Fever
sibiling.content: Every day the body temperature goes up and down. It is usually lowest early in the morning and highest in the late afternoon and early evening. A fever might come slowly and rise over a few days, or it might rise very quickly.

sibiling.name: Causes Of Fever
sibiling.content:
Virus- Viruses cause infections such as cold, upper respiratory tract infections and chickenpox.
Bacteria- Bacteria cause infections as some ear and throat infections, meningitis, urinary tract infections, pneumonia, sore throat, and blood infections.
Allergic Reactions- It may be due to reaction to drugs, vaccines, pollens, and other air pollutants.

sibiling.name: When To See Your Doctor About Fever And High Temperature In Children
sibiling.content:
If the baby is less than three months old and it has a fever. Visit the doctor immediately because it is difficult to know if a serious illness is causing the fever.
a)If the child is between 3â€“12 months and it has a fever. Go to the doctor immediately you notice the fever because there may be a serious illness causing the fever.
b)If the child is older than 12 months go to the doctor if you notice fever and the following signs see:
c)difficulty in breathing
d)Drowsiness
e)Continuous vomiting or stooling
f)A continuous headache, the neck is stiff, and light is hurting the baby's eyes.
g)Looking sicker than before â€“ more pale, weak and restless
h)Refuses to drink and is not urinating as often as before.
i)Has pains
j)Does not improve after 48 hours
k)If you are worried about any other reason
l) If you are worried about any other reason.

sibiling.name: How to Treat Fever
sibiling.content:
It important that you give the baby plenty of fluid to avoid dehydration. If the baby is not taking enough fluid talk to your doctor. Do the following things to help baby overcome the fever
a)Dress the child in light cloths.
b)Avoid fans.
c)Breastfeed the baby more.
d)If the baby is taking baby food, give the normal portion in small bits.
e)If the baby is older than 6 months, continue breastfeeding or giving other food. Give the baby water to drink.
f)Give baby paracetamol and any other drugs according to the doctor's prescription. Do not give overdose because overdose can cause liver damage.Children First Aid: Fever.

spouse.name: What Causes Lack Of Ejaculation?
spouse.content: Lack of ejaculation is caused by sperm entering into the bladder instead of out of the tip of the penis. Lack of ejaculation can be caused by diabetes, injury in the spine, diabetes, surgery of the prostate, urethra, and bladder.Erectile dysfunction ED cause and diagnosis | Andrology Australia

spouse.name: What Are Erection Problems?
spouse.content: An erection problem is when a man cannot make or keep his penis firm enough for him to have sex. An erection problem is also called impotence. Erection problem can start at any age, but it is common among men who are older, men who have other health issues. Most men have erection problem once in a while, and it is normal.

spouse.name: What Causes Erection Problems?
spouse.content:
Erection problems have many causes. The causes of erection problems include:
a) Drinking too much alcohol or smoking.
b) Other health problems, such as diabetes, high blood pressure, anxiety, and depression.
c) Stress.
d) Side effects of some medicines.
e) Physical problems, such as injury to nerves or loss of blood supply to the penis.
f) Surgeries including prostate cancer surgery.

spouse.name: What Are The Symptoms?
spouse.content: The only symptom of an erection problem is the man is not able to get and keep an erection that is strong enough to have sex. A man that has even an erection problem can still have sexual desire, have an orgasm and ejaculate.

spouse.name: How Are Erection Problems Diagnosed?
spouse.content:
The doctor will ask questions about the man's health and carry out a physical examination of the man. The doctor will want to know how often the problem happens. He may do a laboratory test and sometimes a mental health test.
 The doctor can find out if there is an erection problem by asking questions about your health and doing a physical exam. The healthcare provider will want to know how often the problem happens. The doctor's examination, lab tests, and sometimes mental health tests can help find out the cause of the problem.

spouse.name: How To Treat An Erection Problem?
spouse.content:
Treatment of erection problem included many things. The treatment can include
a) Avoiding tobacco and drugs and reducing the drinking of alcohol
b) Identifying and stopping medicines that may be causing the problem.
c) Talking about the issue with your partner
d) Doing sensual exercises and counseling
e) Surgery in the penis and medications.

spouse.name: Will My Pregnancy Affect My Partner's Sexual Interest?
spouse.content: Yes, it may affect your partner's sex drive. Your pregnancy may make you more attractive to your partner, and he may want more sex. It is also possible that your partner becomes worried about the pregnancy, and the burden of being a parent. This may make his sex urge to reduce. Discussing your fears and concerns is important. It will help both of you to relax and enjoy each other.
